Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: LKM SQL to Teradata (TTU)
AUTHOR: Oracle
DESCRIPTION Loading from any ISO SQL staging area to Teradata using either FastLoad, MultiLoad, TPump or Parallel Transporter. This KM executes the following steps, when used with NP_USE_NAMED_PIPED=0: 1. Unloads the data from the source to a flat file located in the TEMP_DIR directory using JSnpsSqlUnload class 2. Loads the data in the C$ temporary table in the staging area by using the specified utility (with the TERADATA_UTILITY option) 3. Removes the temporary data files created (if specified with the DEL_TEMP_FILES option) When used with NP_USE_NAMED_PIPED=1 the KM proceeds as follows: 1. Create names pipe (UNIX only) 2. Startup load utility and includes access module for named pipes 3. Wait for NP_TTU_STARTUP_TIME to let the utility initialize and on windows let it create the pipe 4. Verify that utility process is still alive before 5. Unload data from source into pipe using JSnpsSqlUnload class 6. Waits for load process to finish Utility output is captured into log file in background thread. If JSnpsSqlUnload raises an exception (e.g. SQL syntax error), utility process is killed and named pipe is deleted (UNIX only) Additional information can be found in the Teradata Utilities Documentation. If data is to be loaded directly into target table, the use of IKM SQL to Teradata is recommanded.
REQUIREMENTS - The host of the ODI Agent running the job must have the Teradata Client Utilities installed (fastload ,multiload, tpump and/or parallel transporter)
BASIC CONFIGURATION - Make sure that the Data Server checkbox is checked in your Topology for the Teradata Technology and specify your Teradata server host in the Server field of your Data Server definition. To do that: 1. Edit the "Teradata" Technology definition in the Topology 2. Check the Naming Rules -> Using "Data Server" checkbox 3. Used Term : "Server" 4. Apply your changes 5. Edit your Teradata Dataserver definiton 6. In the Server field, enter the IP name of your Teradata Server (without "COPn") - The Teradata utility command scripts should be stored in a secured directory as they may contain passwords for the Teradata database. They can be deleted by the KM at the end of the job if the DEL_TEMP_FILES option is set to Yes. - Error messages like ...snpssqlunload...java.io.FileNotFoundException: \\.\pipe\odi_pipe_209025_SS_0 (The system cannot find the file specified)... may be raised due to insufficient NP_TTU_STARTUP_TIME - When using TPT, you may need to remove TPT checkpoint files after having submitted an erroneous interface. - When using TPT detailed logs are available using: tlogview -j <Job Id>
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - REPORT_NB_ROWS: List summary of load report in ODI log? - SESSIONS: Min and/or max number of Teradata load sessions to use - DEL_TEMP_FILES: Remove temp files after load? - FIELD_SEP: Column separator for dump file/ pipe - TEMP_DIR: Directory for storing temporary files - DROP_WORK_TABLE: Drop ODI work tables after load? - DROP_TTU_TABLES: Drop Teradata utility tables before load? - TERADATA_UTILITY: Which Teradata load utility to use? - MAX_ALLOWED_ERRORS: specify Teradata ERRLIMIT - COLLECT_STATS: Collect statistics on ODI work table? - VALIDATE: Validate KM options? - NP_USE_NAMED_PIPE: Use named pipe instead of file unload? - NP_ACCESS_MODULE_NAME: Name of Teradata access module for piped mode - NP_TTU_STARTUP_TIME: Delay to allow TTU to startup and create pipe - NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS: Will executing agent run on Windows? - ODI_DDL: Specify, what DDL to be generated?
LIMITATIONS - INTERVAL, TIME and TIME ZONE data types are not/ partially supported. - DATE and TIMESTAMPs are handled down to miliseconds - When used with IKM with COMMIT=NO, last drop table statement issues warning, as table is still locked by pending transaction. - The REPORT_NB_ROWS option generates a warning in the ODI Log. The error message of the task contains the report of the number of rows processed. - Temporary Indexes: HASH index on staging is not supported due to Teradata RDBMS limitation with identity olumns
Set this option to NO if you wish to retain temporary indexes after integration. This could be useful when the same sources tables are used in differents interfaces of a package.
Report the number of rows processed as an exception to the ODI Log (a task reporting the number of rows processed should appear as a warning in the log).

The following example specifies four FastLoad sessions: SESSION 4
The following example specifies ten FastLoad sessions with a minimum of five: SESSIONS 10 5
Uncheck this option if you want to keep the temporary fastload script after integration
Fields Separator when generating temporary files. Data must never contain this character. Default is |

Temporary directory where TTU scripts and temporary data files are stored. You can use relative URL, in this case URL should be relative to the folder where the ODI Agent has been launched.
Notes: - Paths should use specified using "/" on Unix and "\" on Windows. - When using TPT on windows paths must start with drive letter. - When using TPT path must not contain any blanks
Uncheck thit option if you want to keep the work table after integration

This option is intended for development use only. Do NOT use in production!
If activated, drops all Teradata utility tables like - acquisition error table - application error table - log table - work table

Choose the teradata utility to load data choose: TPUMP to use tpump utility MLOAD to use multiload utility FASTLOAD to use fastload utility TPT-LOAD to use parallel transporter (load operator) TPT-SQL-INSERT to use parallel transporter (sql insert operator)
For details and appropriate choice of utility/ load operator, see Teradata documentation: TPUMP Teradata Parallel Data Pump Reference MLOAD Teradata MultiLoad Reference FASTLOAD Teradata FastLoad Reference TPT-LOAD Teradata Parallel Transporter Reference Teradata Parallel Transporter User Guide TPT-SQL-INSERT Teradata Parallel Transporter Reference Teradata Parallel Transporter User Guide

Maximum number of tolerated errors. This corresponds to - ERRLIMIT command in FastLoad, MultiLoad and TPump - ErrorLimit attribute in TPT Load operator Note: TPT SQL Insert operator does not support any error limit. This option is ignored for TPT-SQL-INSERT.
Collect stats on PI of load table?
Collect statistics on primary index of load table?
Validate use of KM and options

This option generates an extra validation step during development. Validations performed are: - Validation of TERADATA_UTILITY option
This option should be turned off for all production use in particular for high-frequency execution. There is not added value in production, only processing overhead.
Use named pipes for data transport?
For more information about named pipes with Teradata utilities, see "Teradata Tools and Utilities Access Modules"
TD access module for NP to use

Depending on platform the Teradata utility is used, differnt Teradata access modules need to be used for named pipes:
For FastLoad, MultiLoad and TPump: - np_axsmod.sl on HP-UX platforms - np_axsmod.so on MP-RAS; IBM-AIX; Solaris SPARC and Solaris Opteron platforms - np_axsmod.dll on Windows platforms
For TPT: - np_axsmodTWB.sl on HP-UX platforms - np_axsmodTWB.so on MP-RAS; IBM-AIX; Solaris SPARC and Solaris Opteron platforms - np_axsmodTWB.dll on Windows platforms
Please refer to TTU and TD access module documentation for more details.

When using named pipes, the TTU creates the named pipe and then accepts data. So before spooling out data into the pipe, the KM waits the specified number of seconds after starting the TTU before spooling data into pipe. The time depends on utility used, platform, CPU workload, network connectivity and so forth and need to be adapted to used systems. Please take into account that this time also needs to fit production environments.
When using named pipes, this options specifies, whether the agent running this interface is on Windows.

Specify handling of temporary tables with the following values: - DROP_CREATE: Always drop and recreate all temporary tables for every execution (default behaviour). - CREATE_DELETE_ALL: Create temporary tables when needed (usually for the first execution only) and use DELETE ALL to drop the temporary table content. Temporary table are reused for subsequent executions. - DELETE_ALL: Do not create temporary tables. Only submit DELETE ALL for all temporary tables. - NONE: Do not issue any DDL on temporary tables. Temporary tables should be handled separately.

Specify primary index for work table. Teradata uses the PI to spread data accross AMPs. Valid options are [PK] Specify primary key of work table. ODI will use ROWID as primary index column. [NOPI] Do not specify primary index for work table (Teradata 13.0 & above only).

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "DELETE_ALL" )>-1) { %>
delete from <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>T","W")?> all
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> update <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> set JRN_CONSUMED = '1' where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>
<% if (odiRef.getOption("TERADATA_UTILITY").equals("MLOAD")) {%> release mload <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "A")%>T <%} else {%> -- Only needed for MLOAD <%};%>

<% /* DDL disabled? */
if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )< 0) { 
%>-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option

<% } /* Primary index ? */ else 
if  ("UPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE")) || "NUPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE"))) {
%>-- No need to explicitely drop primary index

<% /* Hash index ? */ } else 
if ( "HASH".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE")) ) { 
%>drop hash index <%=odiRef.getObjectName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %>

<% /* Other index type */ } else { 
%>drop <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE") %> index <%=odiRef.getObjectShortName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %> on <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>T

<%};%>

<% /* Do we have a PI defined? */ if ("UPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE")) || "NUPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE")) ) { /* Set flag to skip standard table creation */ explicitPIdefined = true; %> <% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )>-1) { %>
create multiset table <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>T","W")?>, no fallback, no after journal, no before journal ( <%=odiRef.getColList("", "\t[CX_COL_NAME]\t"+ /* Is this a date or timestamp field? Then we default to TIMESTAMP(3) to match unload format */ "<? if (\u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022DATE\u0022) ||"+ " \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP\u0022) ||"+ " \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP(0)\u0022) ||"+ " \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP() WITH TIME ZONE\u0022) ||"+ " \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP(0)\u0022)) {?>"+ "TIMESTAMP(3)"+ "<? } else { ?>"+ "[DEST_WRI_DT]"+ "<?};?>"+ odiRef.getInfo("DEST_DDL_NULL"), ",\n", "","")%> ) <%=("UPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE")))?"UNIQUE ":"" %>PRIMARY INDEX <%=odiRef.getObjectShortName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %> <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndexColList( "(", " [CX_COL_NAME] ", ", ", ")" )%>
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>
<%} else {%> -- The create work table will be done by another step <%}%>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "MLOAD" )) {%> drop table <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","WT_<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>","W")?> <%} else {%> -- Only needed for Teradata MultiLoad <%};%>

<% /* DDL disabled? */
if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )<0) { 
%>-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option

<% } /* Explicite PI defined ? */ else
if (explicitPIdefined) {
%>-- Skipped, as table was created in previous step

<%} else {
%>create multiset table <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>T","W")?>,
	no fallback,
	no after journal,
	no before journal
(
	
<% /* No PI ? */
       if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[NOPI]")) 
          out.print(" C$_ROWID	INTEGER,  ");
       else
          out.print(" C$_ROWID	INTEGER  GENERATED ALWAYS AS IDENTITY,  ");
%>
<%=odiRef.getColList("", "\t[CX_COL_NAME]\t"+
	/* Is this a date or timestamp field? Then we default to TIMESTAMP(3) to match unload format */
	"<? if (\u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022DATE\u0022) ||"+
	"         \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP\u0022) ||"+
	"         \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP(0)\u0022) ||"+
	"         \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP() WITH TIME ZONE\u0022) ||"+
	"         \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP(0)\u0022))  {?>"+
		"TIMESTAMP(3)"+
	"<? } else { 					?>"+
		"[DEST_WRI_DT]"+
	"<?};?>"+
	odiRef.getInfo("DEST_DDL_NULL"), ",\n", "","")%>
)
<% /* use key for PI ? */
      if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[PK]")) 
          out.print("primary index (C$_ROWID) ");
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[NOPI]")) 
          out.print(" no primary index ");
%>
<%}%>

<% /* Init Flag for PI */ boolean explicitPIdefined = false;
%><% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "DROP" )>-1) { %>
drop table <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>T","W")?>
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>

# Define Source Data Query query = """
<%for (int i=odiRef.getDataSetMin(); i <= odiRef.getDataSetMax(); i++){%> <%=odiRef.getDataSet(i, "Operator")%> select <%=odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS")%> <%=odiRef.getColList(i, "", "\t[EXPRESSION]", ",\n", "", "")%> from <%=odiRef.getFrom(i)%> where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getFilter(i)%> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter(i)%> <%=odiRef.getJoin(i)%> <%=odiRef.getGrpBy(i)%> <%=odiRef.getHaving(i)%> <%}%>
"""

from jarray import array from java.lang import Thread from java.io import BufferedOutputStream from java.io import PrintStream from java.lang import String from java.lang import Runtime from java.lang import System from java.io import StringWriter from java.io import InputStreamReader from java.io import OutputStreamWriter from java.io import BufferedReader from java.io import BufferedWriter from java.io import FileReader from java.io import FileWriter from jarray import array from jarray import zeros import com.sunopsis.dwg.tools.SqlUnload as JSnpsSqlUnload import java.util.Vector as JVector import threading import time import os
# # Source connection variables # srcdriver = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_JAVA_DRIVER")%>" srcurl = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_JAVA_URL")%>" srcuser = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_USER_NAME")%>" srcpass = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_ENCODED_PASS")%>" fetchsize = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_FETCH_ARRAY")%>"
# # Temporary Files variables # logname = r"<?=odiRef.getFormattedName( "<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>.log", "FILE" )?>" scriptname = r"<?=odiRef.getFormattedName( "<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>.script", "FILE" )?>" outname = r"<?=odiRef.getFormattedName( "<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>.out", "FILE" )?>"
dataname = r"<% if (odiRef.getOption("NP_USE_NAMED_PIPE").equals("1") && odiRef.getOption("NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS").equals("1")) { %><?=odiRef.getFormattedName("//./pipe/odi_pipe_<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>","FILE").replaceAll("/","\\")?><% } else {%><?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>.data","FILE")?><% }; %>"
# # Unload Options # fieldsep = "<%=odiRef.getOption("FIELD_SEP")%>" datefmt = "yyyyMMddHHmmss.SSS" # query has already been defined in previous step
# # Load Options # loadcmd = r"""<% if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "FASTLOAD" )) { %>fastload < "%s" > "%s"<% } else if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "MLOAD" )) { %>mload < "%s" > "%s"<% } else if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "TPUMP" )) { %>tpump < "%s" > "%s"<% } else { %>tbuild -f "%s" > "%s"<%};%> """ loadcmd = loadcmd % (scriptname, logname) utility = r"""<% if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "FASTLOAD" )) { %>fastload<% } else if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "MLOAD" )) { %>mload<% } else if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "TPUMP" )) { %>tpump<% } else { %>tbuild -f %s <%};%> """ <% if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).startsWith( "TPT" )) { %> % (scriptname)<%};%>
lf = None
class Gobbler(Thread): def __init__(self, stream, label): self.br = BufferedReader(InputStreamReader(stream)) self.label = label def run(self): line=self.br.readLine() while (line != None): print >> lf, self.label + line line=self.br.readLine() #print >>lf, "ODI: End of polling of " + self.label
class Writer(Thread): def __init__(self, stream): self.ps = PrintStream(BufferedOutputStream(stream)) def run(self): fsrc = open(r"<?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>.script","FILE")?>", "r") try: for lsrc in fsrc.readlines(): self.ps.println(lsrc) finally: fsrc.close() self.ps.flush() self.ps.close()
#=========================== # snpssqlunload() # executes the SnpsSQLUnload API #=========================== def snpssqlunload(): snpunload = JSnpsSqlUnload()
# Set the parameters cmdline = JVector() cmdline.add(array(["-DRIVER", srcdriver], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-URL", srcurl], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-USER", srcuser], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-PASS", srcpass], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-FILE_FORMAT", "variable"], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-FIELD_SEP", fieldsep], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-FETCH_SIZE", fetchsize], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-FILE", dataname], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-DATE_FORMAT", datefmt], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-QUERY", query], String)) snpunload.setParameters(cmdline)
# Start the unload process snpunload.execute()
#=========================== # load() # executes the file based loadd #=========================== def load(): if os.system(loadcmd) <> 0 : raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-STDKM-10011", "ODIKM-STDKM-10011: Load Error. See {0} for details",[logname])
#=========================== # pipedload() # executes the piped fast or multiload #=========================== def pipedload(): <%if (odiRef.getOption("NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS").equals("0")) {%> pipename = dataname # Create or Replace a unix fifo os.system("rm %s" % pipename) if os.system("mkfifo %s" % pipename) <> 0: raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-TD-10000", "ODIKM-TD-10000: mkfifo error. Unable to create fifo {0}",[pipename]) <%};%>
# Start the load command in a dedicated thread proc = Runtime.getRuntime().exec( utility ) # Prepare stdin, stdout, stderr processing stdOutGobbler = Gobbler(proc.getInputStream(),"") stdErrGobbler = Gobbler(proc.getErrorStream(),"StdErr: ") stdIn = Writer(proc.getOutputStream()) stdOutGobbler.start() stdErrGobbler.start() # Spool script into TTU stdIn.start() # Wait for end of spool, just in case there is a timeout stdIn.join(10000)
# now that the TTU thead has started, wait # some seconds to see if it is running time.sleep(<%=odiRef.getOption("NP_TTU_STARTUP_TIME")%>)
# Check, if process is still alive isAlive = 1 try: rc = proc.exitValue() isAlive = 0 except: pass if (isAlive == 0): <%if (odiRef.getOption("NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS").equals("0")) {%> # Remove pipe before we stop os.system("rm %s" % pipename) <%};%> # Report error raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-TD-LKM-10000", "ODIKM-TD-LKM-10000: Load process did not start or has stopped immediately. See log file for details")
# Start unload process try: snpssqlunload() except: # ckurz: Bug 13792817: # on some OS failure during load causes # a failure of UNload process first # Let's give the loader a bit of time to finish shutdown time.sleep(10)
# if the unload process fails, we have to kill # the load process on the OS. proc.destroy() <%if (odiRef.getOption("NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS").equals("0")) {%> # remove the pipe os.system("rm %s" % pipename) <%};%> raise
#print >>lf, "ODI: Unload completed successfully. Waiting for load to finish..." # At this point, the unload() process has finished, so we need to wait # for the load process to finish proc.waitFor() #print >>lf, "ODI: Load completed. RC=%d" % rc # Wait for last output to be processed by Gobblers, timeout just in case stdOutGobbler.join(10000) stdErrGobbler.join(10000) rc = proc.exitValue() if (rc <> 0): raise OdiKMException("ODIKM-STDKM-10011", "ODIKM-STDKM-10011: Load Error. See {0} for details",[logname])
<% if (odiRef.getOption("NP_USE_NAMED_PIPE").equals("1")) { %> try: lf = open(logname, "w+") pipedload() finally: lf.flush() lf.close() <%} else {%> snpssqlunload() load() <%};%>

<% /* DDL disabled? */ if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )<0) { %>-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option
<% } /* Explicite PI defined ? */ else if (explicitPIdefined) { %>-- Skipped, as stats will be collected later
<%} else { %> <% if ( odiRef.getOption("COLLECT_STATS").equals("1") && odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").length() > 0 && !odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[NOPI]") ) { %> collect stats using sample on <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>T","W")?> column (C$_ROWID) <% } else { %> -- No stats, as no PRIMARY_INDEX specified or COLLECT_STATS disabled. <%};%>
<%}%>

<% /* DDL disabled? */ if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )< 0) { %>-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option
<% } /* [non] unique primary index ? */ else if ("UPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE")) || "NUPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE"))) { %>-- Skipped, as primary index has already been created during table creation
<% /* Hash index ? */ } else if ( "HASH".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE")) ) { %>Create <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE") %> Index <%=odiRef.getObjectName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %> <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndexColList( "(", " [CX_COL_NAME] ", ", ", ")" )%> on <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("TABLE_NAME")%>T","W")?>
<% /* Other index type */ } else { %>Create <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE") %> Index <%=odiRef.getObjectShortName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %> <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndexColList( "(", " [CX_COL_NAME] ", ", ", ")" )%> on <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("TABLE_NAME")%>T","W")?>
<%};%>
Collect stats for Temp Idx on Work

<% /* DDL disabled? */ if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )< 0) { %>-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option
<% } /* [non] unique primary index ? */ else if ("UPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE")) || "NUPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE"))) { %>collect stats using sample <%=("UPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE")))?"unique ":""%> index <%=odiRef.getObjectShortName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %> <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndexColList( "(", " [CX_COL_NAME] ", ", ", ")" )%> on <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>T
<% /* Hash index ? */ } else if ( "HASH".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE")) ) { %>collect stats using sample <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE") %> index <%=odiRef.getObjectName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %> <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndexColList( "(", " [CX_COL_NAME] ", ", ", ")" )%> on <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>T
<% /* Other index type */ } else { %>collect stats using sample <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE") %> index <%=odiRef.getObjectShortName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %> <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndexColList( "(", " [CX_COL_NAME] ", ", ", ")" )%> on <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>T
<%};%>

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> delete from <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> where JRN_CONSUMED = '1' <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>

# Delete script file try: os.remove(r"<?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>.script","FILE")?>") finally: pass
<% if (odiRef.getOption("NP_USE_NAMED_PIPE").equals("0")) {%> # Delete dump file try: os.remove(r"<?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>.data","FILE")?>") finally: pass <%};%>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "DROP" )>-1) { %>
drop view <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "A")%>
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>

<% /* DDL disabled? */
if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )< 0) { 
%>-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option

<% } /* Primary index ? */ else 
if  ("UPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE")) || "NUPI".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex("INDEX_TYPE_CODE"))) {
%>-- No need to explicitely drop primary index

<% /* Hash index ? */ } else 
if ( "HASH".equalsIgnoreCase(odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE")) ) { 
%>drop hash index <%=odiRef.getObjectName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %>

<% /* Other index type */ } else { 
%>drop <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("INDEX_TYPE_CLAUSE") %> index <%=odiRef.getObjectShortName("L",odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("IDX_NAME"),"W") %> on <%=odiRef.getTemporaryIndex ("FULL_TABLE_NAME")%>

<%};%>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "DROP" )>-1) { %>
locking table <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>T","W")?> for exclusive nowait drop table <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>T","W")?>
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "DROP" )>-1) { %>
drop view <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "A")%>
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )>-1) { %>
create view <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "A")%> as select <%=odiRef.getColList("", /* Is this a date ? Then we cast to date. */ "<? if (\u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022DATE\u0022)) {?>"+ "cast(cast([CX_COL_NAME] as varchar(10)) as date)"+ "<? } else ?>"+ /* Is this a date or timestamp field? Then we cast to appropriate TIMESTAMP */ "<? if (\u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP\u0022) ||"+ " \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP(0)\u0022) ||"+ " \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP() WITH TIME ZONE\u0022) ||"+ " \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022.equals(\u0022TIMESTAMP(0)\u0022)) {?>"+ "cast(cast([CX_COL_NAME] as VARCHAR(<? String longc = \u0022[LONGC]\u0022; out.print( new Integer(20+ ((longc.length()>0)?new Integer(longc):new Integer(0)) ).toString() );?>)) as timestamp<? if (longc.length()>0) {?>([LONGC])<?}?>)"+ "<? } else { ?>"+ /* Anything else does not require any casting */ "[CX_COL_NAME]\t\t"+ "<?};?>\t[CX_COL_NAME]"+ odiRef.getInfo("DEST_DDL_NULL"), ",\n\t", "","")%> from <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>T","W")?>
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>

<% if ( odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "MLOAD" ) || odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "TPUMP" )) {%> drop table <?=odiRef.getObjectName("L","LOG_<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>","W")?> <%} else {%> -- Only needed for Teradata MultiLoad adn TPump <%};%>
